conclusion: Truck initial speed is 40 m/s and comes to rest in 20 s; Bus initial speed is 30 m/s and comes to rest in 30 s.
Truck's deceleration is calculated as -2 m/s²; Bus's deceleration is calculated as -1 m/s².
Write truck's speed as a function of time: vₜ(t) = 40 − 2t for 0 ≤ t ≤ 20 s.
Write bus's speed as a function of time: v_b(t) = 30 − 1t for 0 ≤ t ≤ 30 s.
Position of truck by integrating vₜ(t): xₜ(t) = 40t − t² for 0 ≤ t ≤ 20.
Position of bus by integrating v_b(t): x_b(t) = 30t − ½t² for 0 ≤ t ≤ 30.
Separation as a function of time is s(t) = 30 + xₜ(t) − x_b(t) = 30 + 10t − ½t².
Maximum separation occurs when ds/dt = 0, solving gives t = 10 s.
Evaluate s(t) at t = 10 s to find s_max = 80 m.
The greatest distance between the bus and the truck is 80 metres.
